intro: Cochlearia septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are often rosette-shaped and covered in fine hairs to protect against harsh weather conditions.
